nodes.bodyText:
Changing the public method all of a sudden is not good practice as it might break any code that is relying on this particular Util method.
Best way to introduce this change would be to introduce a new method, deprecate the old method and point to the newly introduced method for future usage.
Then, in a major version of the component, we can remove the deprecated method.
Also we can change the old method's implementation to use the newly introduced method

Also we can change the old method's implementation to use the newly introduced method

Agreed on introducing a new method.
With the URL resolver service, DefaultURLResolverService.class takes the tenant name from the ThreadLocal when qualifying paths for tenants. Therefore, the new method would not require the tenant domain as a parameter. Hence, wouldn't it be incorrect if we change the old method to consume the new method?
Yes. Let's leave the old method as it is and a comment to use the new method.

I think this is not needed. What we need to do here is to return the value set at the resident IDP.
It can be a random URI value. Trying to tenant qualify that is incorrect.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -3086,8 +3078,8 @@ public static String getIdTokenIssuer(String tenantDomain) throws IdentityOAuth2
         FederatedAuthenticatorConfig oidcAuthenticatorConfig =
                 IdentityApplicationManagementUtil.getFederatedAuthenticator(fedAuthnConfigs,
                         IdentityApplicationConstants.Authenticator.OIDC.NAME);
-        return IdentityApplicationManagementUtil.getProperty(oidcAuthenticatorConfig.getProperties(),
-                IDP_ENTITY_ID).getValue();
+        return IdentityUtil.resolveURL(IdentityApplicationManagementUtil

nodes.bodyText: For example, I set a value like "https://myissuer.xyz.com" at the resident IDP as the issuer value. When we use the IdentityUtil.resolveURL() method what would be the output?

nodes.bodyText: It would be better to define a constant for "/api/identity/oauth2/dcr/v1.0/register"
This is fixed after adding String constants for OAuth2 endpoints.
remove snapshot version and update to a released version

This will lead to NPE if idpEntityId evaluates to null. Can we be sure that it can never be null?
Also can IdentityUtil.getProperty("OAuth.OpenIDConnect.IDTokenIssuerID") evaluate to null in any scenario?

We should add test cases for legacy mode and new mode and verify OIDC endpoints.
Shall we do that as well.
Shall we add a method level comment?
